subject: Marketing
title: The Poster Boom
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Poster Boom.

hook.text: In 1890s Paris, artists like Toulouse-Lautrec turned advertising posters into collectible art.

buildup.text: Chromolithography made color printing affordable. Suddenly, city walls exploded with imagery.

discovery.text: Posters merged art and commerce. People tore them off walls to keep them.

twist.text: Governments had to pass laws regulating where posters could be placed. Visual pollution was born.

climax.text: The poster proved that beautiful advertising earns attention without interrupting.

punchline.text: Great ads aren't interruptions. They're attractions.

quiz.question: What made the 1890s poster boom possible?
options: Chromolithography made affordable color printing available
Governments required all businesses to use posters
